author: mybrandt
title: OMIMIMO The Pure Water CNFTGame
description: Nous avons tous besoin d'eau pure, alors pourquoi ne pas posséder un actif du monde réel et aider la NFT à protéger la nature tout en acquérant des connaissances et en s'amusant avec le jeu ?

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal aims to bring nature lover gamers into the Cardano blockchain. More in detail, the game proposed is based on connecting the activity of a real natural reserve to a game that utilizes a token (OMIMIMO) that represents an amount of pure water, necessary to survive in the game. Moreover, the game aims to use NFTs to represent different species in nature and bring knowledge to the users about these species. 
The revenue model will be based on a play to earn. 
Through the NPO in the wild the team will combine real facts and protected areas with gaming. A part of the project will be dedicated to have a tracking of the water quality in the reserve to maintain it clear and unpolluted.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the idea at the base of the game is excellent, the tokenomics it is still unclear, as well as how the users will use their NFTs to advance in the game. Plus, according to the  roadmap, by the end of 2021 the NFTs would have been brought to life, but I have not seen any info on their website.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has outlined a clear timeline and the budget breakdown is detailed. However, as stated above, there are some mission connections between the data collected into the blockchain representing purity of the water and the amount of token in the game available. For example: is there a token scarcity dependence on the real nature reserve data ?

f6_assessments.q0: Very interesting concept and noble in practice. I think it would be a great addition to the Cardano ecosystem although more information as to the areas/location that will be focused on as well as the government municipalities, laws and organizations that are going to be approach to kickstart this solution needs to be presented.
f6_assessments.q1: There is ample experience showcased in this proposal on the development side but more clarity on the regulatory aspect that encompass this solutions needs to be addressed
f6_assessments.q2: I think with more work and some conversations and disvussion down the track this could be an amazing addition to the space but overall kpis and funding seams achievable for the development framework.

f6_assessments.q0: I love how founding team made their meaningful project with NFT gaming ideas, one of the impactful proposals to this challenge, it will not just attract finance-driven players only but also those who love nature and others to join and enjoy the game so far. In addition, their numbers and targets inside the detailed explanation about how the game going, and inside development timeline/ roadmap can prove to us that this project will strongly impact to Cardano ecosystem when successfully launching. Moreover, it will motivate other NGO to develop like them. Absolutely rate 5!

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal points to the problem but does not clearly explain the solution to how the problem will be solved. Through the description of the plan, it can be read how this proposal will have an positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem and how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. It would be good to make subtitle KPIs so that the reader can get information on whether KPIs indicated in the proposal match the ones indicated in the challenge. This proposal is not able to scale and address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer unfortunately did not provide information on what experience and skills will be necessary to deliver on the proposal also we do not have information about the team. It would be good that the team is transparent to know if the team has the necessary skills, knowledge, experience to realize this idea. Maybe open accounts via LinkedIn or Github or a team information via website. It would be great if the proposal had a clear subtitle Budget where we could get clearer insights on how the budget will be distributed. The budget is clearly written but unfortunately unrealistically presented and an additional funding is not required. It would be great to have a subtitle Plan in the proposal to make it understandable what will happen to the whole project. Proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work and actionable tasks and order of execution should be more clearly explained. Unfortunately in this proposal we don't not have clearly defined resources, technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies needed for implementation. Risks and the idea of risks and how to deal with possible risks is missing.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement is vaguely presented. Unfortunately KPIs are fuzzily presented and in no way can be used to quantify the success of the project. The community can hardly keep up with the development of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Definitely, everything is well explained. The concept of owning real land with token is fresh and interesting with addition that there will be a playable game associated with the same land. Although it will not run on ADA itself but on OMIMIMO token. But that is one of core things about Cardano, to use multiple currencies.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a great chance of success. Combination of saving the environment will attract people with addition of owning a piece of land somewhere in wilderness. The team looks to be experienced.
f6_assessments.q2: Information is more then sufficient. Explained well into details, stage by stage. Progress can be monitored over each quartal to see how it is going.

f6_assessments.q0: This seems to have a lot of interesting ideas.  If I am understanding correctly, the developer intends to purchase land in Sweden or Norway (?) and connect it with NFTs on Cardano so that players of the game hold an interest in the area being preserved.  The English is not perfect so it is possible that something is being lost in interpretation.  If handled well, this could indeed attract players who are interested in such things.  The images shown look well-created and attractive.  Would be nice to have more information on how exactly the game will function.  Is it a 3d immersive world?  Browser-based?  Point and click?
f6_assessments.q1: The concept of an educational survival game linked to this is pretty good, however it seems unclear how the team intends to preserve/protect the environment/water which is to be a crucial point of this project.  The developer is clear that the game intends to show information and educate users about nature, survival, and the importance of clean water, which is great, but the real-world side of this implementation needs to be clarified, such as HOW this are of nature will be defended, what will be done to ensure the water quality, and other important aspects of defending natural resources.  Additionally, the website for the project lacks any information on the team members involved, and has very little information of use while relying heavily on vague statements and stock images.  Neither the website nor the writeup on the concept provide enough detail to show how the team intends to accomplish these goals.  In order to successfully implement a plan, there needs to be a clear representation of what exactly is being planned, and, while there is some information on what they intend to do game-wise, once again there is a lack of information as to how this will cross over to the proposed "saving of untouched nature in different parts of the world."  The lack of clarity would make it hard to measure success.  Strongly suggest that proposer provide more information on how the real-world aspect will be handled, as well as more information on the developer team such as what they have worked on before and what they will be doing for this project.  Provide information on how the land/water will be protected.  Show how the players will contribute to that protection.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided, while providing a fair idea of how the game intends to be pursued, does not fully allow for the auditing of all the ideas put forth, especially on the real-world side.  Would highly recommend developer provide additional details such as what quantifies "success" in both the virtual and real world.  Selling the NFT project in this case would be the beginning, not the end, and while putting that on the roadmap is helpful, there should be a better indication of how that will be used to ensure the success of the project both on-chain and in the real world.
